lines.text: I'm not an orphan! I don't belong here! I have a grandfather!
Peter wouldn't leave without saying goodbye to me.
Heidi, you have not yet decide that you are going.
I'm packing, Grandfather.
Oh yes, yes. But you must decide here
[points to heart]
'I am going'.

[After Peter tackles her]
I hate you.
No, you don't.
You're not the only one that can have an adventure.
The mountain is inside you. It will always be there, but so will its harship.
I've never felt it.
Peter, promise me you'll watch out for Grandfather.
I promise.
[gives Heidi his pan pipes]
So you don't forget me at your fancy school.
Heidi, the girls and I were wondering where did you get those clothes?
Oh, I made them.
How quaint. They're positively dreadful.
Those children are under my care; I will not let them go! You don't understand, I will not! This is my house and that man will not take those children away!
We must go before they see us.
They won't see us, they're kissing.
Kissing! It was more like they were mashing thier faces together.
Ursula, I live on the other side of that snow. I know how to get home! Don't you know how to get home?
Anywhere a goat can go, we can go. Grandfather told me.
I'll contact the school. I'm certain I can get through from my post.
Then say I am coming. I'll bring Heidi back myself.
Grandfather, no. The country is at war, it's too dangerous.
All the more reason to go.
The Italian army has taken over the railroad. You would have to travel by foot.
Heidi cannot make the journey alone.
First, let me contact the school. I'm sure they've made arrangements for their children to travel safely home. And if not, I will go and get her.
I have old man's imagination. It runs away with me.
To our hero.
Which one?
You'll come back?
I will if you don't go running off again.
I will if I want to.
Then, I'll have to make sure that you don't want to.
